title: Error `fx/defn expects a map of cofx as first argument...` if try to delete custom bootnode
body:
### Description

[comment]: # (Feature or Bug? i.e Type: Bug)
*Type*: Bug

[comment]: # (Describe the feature you would like, or briefly summarise the bug and what you did, what you expected to happen, and what actually happens. Sections below)
*Summary*: On attempt to delete custom bootnode got error and bootnode is not deleted
```
02-22 12:00:49.084 12315 12355 I ReactNativeJS: MESSAGE: fx/defn expects a map of cofx as first argument got :bootnodes.ui/delete-pressed in function function (e) {switch(arguments.length){case 1:return status_im.bootnodes.core.show_delete_bootnode_confirmation.cljs$core$IFn$_invoke$arity$1(arguments[0]);case 2:return status_im.bootnodes.core.show_delete_bootnode_confirmation.cljs$core$IFn$_invoke$arity$2(arguments[0],arguments[1]);default:throw Error(["Invalid arity: ",cljs.core.str.cljs$core$IFn$_invoke$arity$1(arguments.length)].join(""))}}
```

#### Expected behavior
[comment]: # (Describe what you expected to happen.)
bootnode item is deleted
#### Actual behavior
[comment]: # (Describe what actually happened.)
error `fx/defn expects a map of cofx as first argument...` 
![screenshot_20190222-120052](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6584810/53238771-7fe3a680-369a-11e9-991f-786f4ad2012a.png)

### Reproduction
[comment]: # (Describe how we can replicate the bug step by step.)

- Open Status, sign in
-  Add custom bootnode: Profile -> bootnodes -> + Specify "custom node" as name and paste to address value `enode://a8a97f126f5e3a340cb4db28a1187c325290ec08b2c9a6b1f19845ac86c46f9fac2ba13328822590fd3de3acb09cc38b5a05272e583a2365ad1fa67f66c55b34@167.99.210.203:30404`
- Save it and sign in again
- Open Profile -> bootnodes -> tap on newly added "custom node" -> tap on Delete



### Additional Information
[comment]: # (Please do your best to fill this out.)
* Status version: nightly Feb 22
* Operating System: Android and iOS

#### Logs

[Status.log](https://github.com/status-im/status-react/files/2893640/Status.log)
